Pediatric_Dose.text:
“Emergent Intramuscular Dosing can be given if child is not tolerating oral medications”
[1]
or unable to get IV within 15 minutes.
IM hydrocortisone sodium succinate
(Solu-Cortef)
25 mg for child 3 years and younger
50 mg for children >3 yrs – 12 years
100 mg for children 12 years and older.

tables.Category: Minor procedure or surgery under local anesthesia (eg, inguinal hernia repair)
Moderate surgical stress (eg, lower extremity revascularization, total joint replacement)
tables.Subsequent: 25 mg of hydrocortisone every eight hours for 24 hours. Resume usual dose thereafter.

tables.Category: Major surgical stress (eg, esophagogastrectomy, total proctocolectomy, open heart surgery)
tables.Subsequent: 50 mg every eight hours for 24 hours. Taper dose by half per day to maintenance level.
